Articles.Content: It looks great. Although the doors are a little small and the clipping is a bit strange, but I'd love to see the interior

It looks great. Although the doors are a little small and the clipping is a bit strange, but I'd love to see the interior

Give me a few min and I ll take some pics

So as part of my Revival Protocol, I decided I would replace the Glory Class Carrier and make something a bit more modern. So to prepare for .25 I played around with SP+ and here are the results. Carries 4 Cherub Class fighters. Also can hold 11 kerbals I won't be submitting it yet as I want to make her stock when .25 comes out.

Glad to see your getting back into making your supercarrier.

It be a shame if a destroyer came along and "put a dent into it"

Ah, so revival protocol is like the A.R.K initiative, Having craft ready for .25 for part-by-part replacement. I'd recommend having non winged versions ready as well. The doorway looks fine to me, big enough to fit any size of light fighter through and turn once inside.

http://i.imgur.com/5SCLVnd.png

It would be a shame if a battlecruiser/carrier, 10 medium fighters, 20 light fighters, and whatever else you can fit in after came out the hanger first.

PS: That carrier looks insane Spartwo, how many parts?

Hopefully your filmed time to edited time ratio is better than HOCs. As for part count, about 800. It'll go up to 1000 by the time I'm done because I need to close the front end and complete the paneling on the back. The interior is already fleshed out and the distance from side to side is about the length of a vulture class.

EDIT: Maybe not widthwise but definitely lengthwise, I checked and it fits with room for the fighters.

Edited September 28, 2014 by Spartwo

Hopefully your filmed time to edited time ratio is better than HOCs. As for part count, about 800. It'll go up to 1000 by the time I'm done because I need to close the front end and complete the paneling on the back. The interior is already fleshed out and the distance from side to side is about the length of a vulture class.

Sounds good, and with a relatively low part count like that I might actually use it in the series if not some other kind of video. As for my footage to final product ratio: below average (6 hours of 'filming', and I use the term loosely, equals about 1 to 2 hours of footage. The average episode of KS usually takes roughly 5 hours worth of footage to make). However it really depends on what type of video I'm making and what I'm going to do with it in post. An entire day of shooting for a film may only produce 1 minute of edited video whereas an evening of crash-free/bug-free recording can make up a whole episode of KS.

Edited September 28, 2014 by HatBat

internal pics for Dorchester Carrier Prototype

Coming in the door

Before being loaded with fighters

After

It gets close to 700 parts with all the fighters in it but also keep in mind this is the prototype. I ll make the real thing when .25 comes out
Wow, that's amazing. What do you think of a little save-sharing battle between the Albion and the Dorchester some time tomorrow?

Wow, that's amazing. What do you think of a little save-sharing battle between the Albion and the Dorchester some time tomorrow?

Let me PM you

I forgot that I had removed a row of fighter racks to reduce part count, so only 8 medium fighters and 16 light ones.

I shall call it an Xzibit* class(maybe)

Still some strutting to do but I'm usually thrifty with those and they aren't physics calculated anyway and giving it a good turn rate, be it with vernor engines like the Curtana or with a ton of gyroscopes.

*Why is this in the database but I had to put colour in manually.

Edited September 29, 2014 by Spartwo

I shall call it an Xzibit* class(maybe)

Yes. Please do.

In other news, I'm working on some new ships... including a new experiment in MAC-gun type weapons...

More info coming soon.

Does anyone know how .25 will effect the current wings? I don't know if its going to mess most of my stuff up so I guess I'll wait awhile before actually submitting anything. But for now here's an idea of what is soon to come.

I forgot that I had removed a row of fighter racks to reduce part count, so only 8 medium fighters and 16 light ones.

I shall call it an Xzibit* class(maybe)

http://i.imgur.com/T7GHZ9c.png

http://i.imgur.com/m6Eteb4.png

Still some strutting to do but I'm usually thrifty with those and they aren't physics calculated anyway and giving it a good turn rate, be it with vernor engines like the Curtana or with a ton of gyroscopes.

*Why is this in the database but I had to put colour in manually.

Great now launch it into orbit

Edit: does anyone else hear Imperal March when looking at it

Does anyone know how .25 will effect the current wings?

I think they're getting removed.

I think they're getting removed.

0_o

Well, gosh darn it. I guess I'll have to update all of my aircraft once it come out...

Do you think they'll remove the current control surfaces, too?
They're going to have a grace period with both and then remove the c7 parts.

They're going to have a grace period with both and then remove the c7 parts.

I guess I'll have to rebuild everything. This is actually a good change, forcing us to clear out our old craft.

Found this thread and started watching your series and I'm really loving it. I'll make an official submission once 0.25 comes out and I tweak my craft, but here's a link to my ships at Lotus Corp. There's also a link in my sig. Looking forward to another season!

Noob, check the OP for the rules on mods, only SP+ is allowed for space combat vessels, however exceptions are made rarely, and only for the listed mods.
